data.title: First time: Gumbo
data.text:
We were thrilled when we found out about the French Quarter, as we are gumbo lovers. Of course, we ordered the delicious gumbo. The serving was large enough that we brought leftovers home. Aside from the gumbo, we began with fried pickles and buttered toast. They don't have a dessert menu yet. 
The atmosphere is casual. We hope very much that this place succeeds, as it should. It is a welcome addition to Bellflower.

data.title: French Quarter Creole Bar & Grill
data.text:
It is new but they need a lot of work to make it go. The food was just okay, I had the fried Catfish and it came out cold. I ask for tarter sauce and they brought me one small package. The rice & beans side I ordered was good.
I think the problem is they have a very small kitchen with inadequate equipment to really make a lot of food correctly. The happy hour drink specials were ok (2 for 1) but came out to $5.00/drink for a well liquor and drink specials are $7.00 ea. The service was slow and spotty.

data.title: Louisiana Taste Sensation
data.text: The French Quarter was a delight.  It's a great gathering place for couples, friends, and family.  Our server, Liza, was very attentive and gracious.   It was our first time, but not our last.  The food was exception--great flavors.  Try it--you will be back.  It has a large area for dancing, with music on weekends.  A full service bar, with friendly people and servers.    The owner personally comes to your table to ensure you are enjoying your meal and evening.  It's a wonderful experience.
